intro: Harperocallis, commonly known as the golden bellvista, is a genus of flowering plants in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and prefers well-drained, moist soil. Harperocallis species are known for their upright growth habit and their ability to thrive in partial to full shade. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are relatively low maintenance in the garden.
